abstract.p: Personal Shopper column on space-saving, dual-purpose furniture; photos (M)

block.p: GOOD-LOOKING and multitalented. Sleek, with a sense of humor.'' If a stool, table or chair could write a personal ad, that's what these pieces would say. They are space-savers that can do double duty, making a small place more comfortable and fun. But generally speaking, this will not be a cheap date.

1. Stackable stools of maple plywood by Pablo Pardo have removable rubber tops so the cylinders can be used for storage. They come in two heights: 16 inches ($120) or 21 inches ($150). A 48-inch-long laminate top ($90) turns two stools into a coffee table; a 24-inch round top ($70, not shown) makes one stool into a table ($70). The stainless steel serving bowl ($35) is handy for chips or fruit. Twelve-inch-high stools (not shown) for children will be available in December in four colors: aqua, yellow, red or orange. All are available from Pablo, www.pablodesigns.com or (415) 822-2712.

The tightly woven paper rug with nonskid rubber backing (6 by 9 feet) resembles sisal but is not scratchy; $419 at Workbench, 470 Park Avenue South (31st Street).

2. Trans is a chair, a storage unit or a 16 1/2-inch-high coffee table. It is available in maple (shown) or cherry veneer. The doors on the low storage bin come in aluminum or painted black. Trans is made to order and is $3,500 from KJ Studios, (614) 224-9190, or www.kjstudios.com.

3. Scolaro has an 18-inch-high seat with an attached table that is 29 inches high ($250). You can sit facing the table or relax by facing the other way while someone else uses the table. Also available with a 27-inch-high seat and 38-inch-high table ($275). Both are made of beechwood by Montina in Italy. At Property, 14 Wooster Street (Grand Street).

4. Lulu, a chrome-edged Formica kitchen table, has a pullout computer keyboard shelf that also works for a laptop. The 30-inch-high table, with locking wheels, has a 32-by-24-inch top; $165 at Sam Flax, 12 West 20th Street. The 26-inch-high chrome stool with vinyl seat is $39 from Bowery Kitchen Supply, 460 West 16th Street, or www.bowerykitchens.com.

5. Gemini, by Johnny Poux, a designer in Hastings, N.Y., is a mahogany plywood table (24 by 18 inches) on stainless steel legs. A simple pull cord turns it into a chair; $2,310 at Breukelen, 68 Gansevoort Street (Washington Street).
